answers.author: Brian Halverson
answers.text:
Hi Gaylene,
Our City has 30 CNG side-loader refuse collection trucks.  I'd be happy to share what we've learned so far.  (210) 207-6451.
Cheers,
Brian

answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
Questions similar to your own have been previously asked on the Knowledge Network. You can view the answers others received below. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/21194
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/20424
This question addresses fueling stations.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/20065
This article discusses how the town of Fairfield, CT started using natural gas vehicles a couple of years ago. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301308/Town_of_Fairfield_CT_diversifies_it_fuel_supply_with_296530_grant_for_natural_gas_vehicles_and_refue
Also, this spreadsheet from a Knowledge Network survey lists places that use alternative fuel vehicles.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302034/Alternative_Fuels_Survey_Speadsheet
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gaylene Rhoden
text: Has anybody had experience with compressed natural gas for their municipal vehicles? How much did the conversion cost (retro fit)? Is there a savings? Where is the fueling source? What types of vehicles use it? Thank you.
title: Compressed Natural Gas
